title: Tallulah Willis pays homage to father Bruce Willis on Halloween with revealing Fifth Element costume
text:
Her father Bruce Willis starred in 1997's sci-fi action film The Fifth Element alongside Milla Jovovich, who filled the role of attractive extraterrestrial Leeloo.

And Tallulah Willis channeled her dad's costar with her own take on Leeloo's iconic white bandage outfit complete with a choker neck and an orange bob wig.

Tallulah, 25, served some intense looks against a concrete wall with her arms outstretched and posed in a chair with one of her toned legs propped up on a table.

Far out: Tallulah Willis channeled her dad's costar on Sunday with her own take on Leeloo's iconic white bandage outfit complete with a choker neck and an orange bob wig

Bruce portrayed a cab driver on a mission to protect Leeloo and maintain peace in a far-out world.

The photos come a couple of weeks after the daughter of Demi Moore and Bruce revealed her struggle with suicidal thoughts.

She took to Instagram on Oct. 10 to re-post a video of herself dancing in a bikini from December 2018.

Disguised: Tallulah, 25, served some intense looks against a concrete wall with her arms outstretched

Fan favorite: Bruce portrayed a cab driver on a mission to protect Leeloo and maintain peace in a far-out world

'We are not what we show,' she captioned the re-post. 'When I filmed this video I remember everyone telling me over and over how much they wished they had my energy, my freeness, a ownership of self.

'When this video was filmed I was 3 months into the deepest suicidal hole I had ever been in.'

She continued to say that she is 'scared' of her brain and 'the capacity for pain it has and will continue to bear.'

'My fight is daily and for the duration of my life and each day I choose to find the glowed moments, a thefted giggle, or true peaceful pause,' she continued.

Halloween-ready: She also posed in a chair with one of her toned legs propped up on a table

The original: Her father Bruce Willis starred in 1997's sci-fi action film The Fifth Element alongside Milla Jovovich, who filled the role of attractive extraterrestrial Leeloo

Tallulah has battled with self-esteem issues since childhood, as she divulged to Teen Vogue in 2015.

'I haven’t felt OK with who I am since I was 11 years old,' she told the outlet.

'Suddenly, I didn’t think I deserved what I had grown up with, and I remember thinking I couldn’t have problems, so I kept everything bottled up inside.'

The 5ft 4in beauty also revealed a diagnosis of body dysmorphia to StyleLikeU in 2014 - dropping to as low as 95 pounds as a result.
